entry.et: Middle English, from Anglo-French prier, praer, preier, from Latin precari, from prec-, prex request, prayer; akin to Old High German frāga question, frāgēn to ask, Sanskrit pṛcchati he asks

def.dt: :entreat implore often used as a function word in introducing a question, request, or plea pray be careful
:to make a request in a humble manner
:to address God or a god with adoration, confession, supplication, or thanksgiving
